method.name: emulation_igmp_querier_config
method.description: This procedure is used to configure the IGMP Querier on a specified Ixia port.

description.text: This option defines the action to be taken.

choice.choiceText: Creates the IGMP querier router on the Ixia interface.
Modifies the IGMP querier router on the Ixia interface.
Deletes the IGMP querier router on the Ixia interface.
The IGMP querier router will be disabled.
Enables the IGMP querier router on the Ixia interface.

description.text: Defines the number of sessions to create on the interface. Valid for mode create.

When -discard_learned_info is 0, the emulated Querier maintains a complete record state for received reports and send queries (based on timer expiry for received groups and sources). If -discard_learned_info is 1, the Querier does not maintain any database and only sends periodic general queries. The specific query group/source record information is not calculated based on any earlier received Report, but is based only on the last received report.
Specifies whether the emulated IGMP Querier is active or not.
General Query Response Interval in milliseconds

IGMP Host handle if the option -mode is delete, modify, disable, enable. When -handle is provided with the /globals value the arguments that configure global protocol setting accept both multivalue handles and simple values. When -handle is provided with a a protocol stack handle or a protocol session handle, the arguments that configure global settings will only accept simple values. In this situation, these arguments will configure only the settings of the parent device group or the ports associated with the parent topology.
The version of IGMP to be used: v1, v2, v3. Valid for mode create.

A handle or list of the handles that are returned from the interface_config call. These provide a direct link to an already existing interface and supercede the use of the intf_ip_addr value.

Starting with IxNetwork 5.50 this parameter accepts handles returned by pppox_config procedure in the following format: (PPPoX Range Handle)|(interface index X),(interface index Y)-(interface index Z), ...

The PPPoX ranges are separated from the Interface Index identifiers with the (|) character. The Interface Index identifiers are separated with comas (,). A range of Interface Index identifiers can be defined using the dash (-) character.

Ranges along with the Interface Index identifiers are grouped together in TCL Lists. The lists can contain mixed items, protocol interface handles returned by interface_config and handles returned by pppox_config along with the interface index. Valid for mode create.
IP address of the test interface / emulated IGMP Host. Valid for mode create and modify.
The IP address step between each session. Valid for mode create and modify.
The netmask length value for the interface. Valid for mode create and modify.
If true (1), enable IP Router Alert Option. Valid for mode create and modify.
The MAC address for the interface to be created. Valid for mode create and modify.
The incrementing step for the MAC address of the interface to be created. Valid only when using IxNetwork Tcl API. Valid for mode create and modify.
The number of reports that an IGMP Querier sends out during the specified time period. This parameter is only applicable for IGMP Queriers.
The time period (milliseconds) for sending out IGMP queries. This parameter is only applicable for IGMP Queriers.
IP address of the neighbor.
The IP address step between each session.

If this option is enabled, the interface existence check is skipped but the list of interfaces is still created and maintained in order to keep track of existing interfaces, if required. Using this option will speed up the creation of interfaces. Valid for mode create.

If this option is enabled, the list of interfaces will not be created and maintained anymore, thus speeding up the creation of interfaces even more. Also, it will enable -override_existence_check in case it was not already enabled, because checking for interface existence becomes impossible if the the list of interfaces doesnt exist anymore. Valid for mode create.
The port on which the operation will apply.
Clear all existent hosts. Valid for mode create.

Defines the subnet vulnerability to lost packets. IGMP can recover from robustness variable minus 1 lost IGMP packets. The robustness variable should be set to a value of 2 or greater (7 being the maximum).

The maximum amount of time in seconds that the IGMP Querier waits to receive a response to a Specific Query message. The default query response interval is 1000 milliseconds and must be less than the query interval. This parameter will be set (-mode create and -modify) only if discard_learned_info is not enabled.

Indicates the total number of specific Query messages sent every Specific Query Response Interval seconds before assuming that there is no interested listener for the particular group/source. This parameter will be set (-mode create and -modify) only if discard_learned_info is not enabled.
The number of general query messages sent at startup.
Indicates whether or not the Querier participates in querier election. If disabled, then all incoming query messages are discarded.
Indicates whether the Querier will comply to RFC 3376 Section 7.3.2 and RFC 3810 Section 8.3.2. If disabled, all membership reports with a version less than the current version are discarded.
Indicates whether the Querier downgrades to the lowest version of received query messages. If disabled, all query messages with a version less than the current version are discarded.

Enables vlan on the directly connected IGMP router interface. Valid options are: 0 - disable, 1 - enable. This option is valid only when -mode is create or -mode is modify and -handle is an IGMP router handle. This option is available only when IxNetwork tcl API is used.
VLAN ID for emulated router node. Valid for mode create and modify.
For multiple neighbor configuration, configures the VLAN ID mode to fixed or increment. Valid for mode create and modify.

When -vlan_id_mode is set to increment, this defines the step for every VLAN. Valid for mode create.

When vlan_id_step causes the vlan_id value to exceed it's maximum value the increment will be done modulo (number of possible vlan ids). Examples:

  • vlan_id = 4094; vlan_id_step = 2 -> new vlan_id value = 0
  • vlan_id = 4095; vlan_id_step = 11 -> new vlan_id value = 10
VLAN user priority assigned to emulated router node. Valid for mode create and modfiy.
Represents the general query response interval in ms
The number of reports that an IGMP Querier sends out during the specified time period. This parameter is only applicable for IGMP Queriers.
The time period (milliseconds) for sending out IGMP queries. This parameter is only applicable for IGMP Queriers.
Enable/Disable Rate Control
Name of the igmp protocol as it should appear in the IxNetwork GUI

returnValue.value: A list containing the igmp querier protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the ethernet protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the ipv4 protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the dhcpv4 client protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the pppox client protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the pppox server protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).

A list containing individual interface, session and/or router handles that were added by the command (if any). Please note that this key will be omitted if the current session or command were run with -return_detailed_handles 0.

A list containing individual interface, session and/or router handles that were added by the command (if any). Please note that this key will be omitted if the current session or command were run with -return_detailed_handles 0.
The handles for the IGMP Querier created
If status is failure, detailed information provided.

notes.note: When -handle is provided with the /globals value the arguments that configure global protocol setting accept both multivalue handles and simple values. When -handle is provided with a a protocol stack handle or a protocol session handle, the arguments that configure global settings will only accept simple values. In this situation, these arguments will configure only the settings of the parent device group or the ports associated with the parent topology. If the current session or command was run with -return_detailed_handles 0 the following keys will be omitted from the command response: igmp_querier_handles, interface_handle

code_examples.example:
# Command :- ::ixiangpf::emulation_igmp_querier_config
#This example will create an IGMP Querier
set igmp_querier_1_status [::ixiangpf::emulation_igmp_querier_config \ -mode create \ -discard_learned_info 1 \ -active 1 \ -general_query_response_interval 10000 \ -handle <ipv4_handle> \ -igmp_version v2 \ -ip_router_alert 1 \ -robustness_variable 2 \ -specific_query_response_interval 1000 \ -specific_query_transmission_count 2 \ -startup_query_count 2 \ -support_election 1 \ -support_older_version_host 1 \ -support_older_version_querier 1 \ -query_interval 125 \ -name {IGMP Querier 1} \ ]
# The command above will generate output as shown below: # {status 1} {igmp_querier_handle igmpQuerierHandle}
#This example will modify an IGMP Querier
set igmp_querier_modified [::ixiangpf::emulation_igmp_querier_config \ -mode modify \ -handle <igmp_querier_handle> \ -active 0 \ ]
# The command above will generate output as shown below: # {status 1}
